attributes.action: Swap the salaries of Nurses and Members of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: During the Corona Virus Crisis, we have learnt to appreciate what or medical staff do for us and how important they are to society that is why we put forward a petition to exchange the salaries between Members of Parliament and the medical staff on the front line in our NHS.
attributes.background:
The starting salary for a nurse working in the NHS is circa £24,000
The starting salary of a Member of Parliament is circa £80,000

We feel that it is only fair that nurses earn what a Member of Parliament currently does and that Members of Parliament should earn what nurses do.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for setting MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a minimum starting wage of £40000 for all Nurses: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315297

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

Give NHS staff a pay rise in line with MPs pay increase: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313513
